sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Medicina hydrostatica, or, Hydrostaticks applyed to the materia medica shewing how by the weight that divers bodies, us'd in physick, have in water : one may discover whether they be genuine or adulterate : to which is subjoyn'd a previous hydrostatical way of estimating ores / by the Honourable Robert Boyle ... Boyle, Robert, 1627-1691.
[24], 217, [7] p., [2], 14 p.
Printed for Samuel Smith ..., London : 1690.
Half title: Experiements and observations, relating to the materia medica. Tome I. No more published. "A catalogue of the philosophical books and tracts, written by the Honourable Robert Boyle Esq. ..." with special t.p.: [2], 14 p. at end. Imperfect: Half title and "A catalgue ..." lacking in film. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======

Boyle, Robert, 1627-1691.
[24], 217, [7] p., [2], 14 p.
Printed for Samuel Smith ..., London : 1690.
Half title: Experiements and observations, relating to the materia medica. Tome I. No more published. "A catalogue of the philosophical books and tracts, written by the Honourable Robert Boyle Esq. ..." with special t.p.: [2], 14 p. at end. Imperfect: Half title and "A catalgue ..." lacking in film.
